title: Simulation-Based Medical Education for K-12: Project-Based Learning with High-Fidelity Virtual Patient Scenarios

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic medical terminology and diagnostic procedures, with PBL (Problem-Based Learning) experience
context.additional_context: Context-based learning through patient simulation scenarios in smartphone-centric limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Learners can identify at least three emergency symptoms (burns, bleeding, allergic reactions) and perform appropriate initial treatments via simulated patient scenarios.
Learners can reduce treatment delay time by 20% compared to baseline scenarios when applying high-fidelity simulated patient techniques.
Learners can accurately utilize 80% of items in a patient status assessment checklist during team-based decision-making processes.

resources: Low-cost simulated patient materials (silicone skin, artificial blood, etc.)
Smartphone app-based diagnostic tool (blood pressure/pulse simulation)
Patient symptom cards and treatment protocol manual
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
